description: Merging Overlapped DateTime Periods with Different Appraoches
body:
/* =================================================================================================================================================================================
-- Database		: User Database
-- Script		: Merging Overlapped DateTime Periods with Different Approaches (Gaps And Islands Concept)
-- Description	: Merging Overlapped DateTime Periods of below Scenarios with Event1(E1) and Event2 (E2)
----$BeginRegion: Test Events for Demonstrating the Merging of Overlapping Events
	----Input:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
	----1	E1 = 00:00:00.000 to 00:30:00.000 ; E2 = 00:30:01.000 to 02:00:00.000 => 2nd Event Started Just After 1st Event Completed with 1 second Diff -- Finish to Start
	----2	E1 = 03:00:00.000 to 05:00:00.000 ; E2 = 04:00:00.000 to 06:00:00.000 => 2nd Event Started While 1st Event is Still in Progress -- Start to Start with Lag -- OverLapped
	----3	E1 = 07:00:00.000 to 09:00:00.000 ; E2 = 08:00:00.000 to 09:00:00.000 => 2nd Event Completed Along with 1st Event eventhough 2nd Event Started Later -- Finish to Finish
	----4	E1 = 10:00:00.000 to 11:00:00.000 ; E2 = 10:00:00.000 to 12:00:00.000 => 2nd Event Started Along with 1st Event But 2nd Event Completed Later -- Start to Start
	----5	E1 = 13:00:00.000 to 16:00:00.000 ; E2 = 14:00:00.000 to 15:00:00.000 => 2nd Event Started After 1st Event and Completed Before 1st Event -- Complete Overlapped Event
	----6	E1 = 17:00:00.000 to 18:00:00.000 ; E2 = 19:00:00.000 to 20:00:00.000 => 2nd Event Started with Gap After 1st Event Completed -- Finish to Start with Lag -- No OverLap
----$EndRegion: Test Events for Demonstrating the Merging of Overlapping Events
-- Usage		: Use the Sample Data and Choose an Approach to Get the Required Result Set
	--Approach #1: This Approach is helpful to Merge DateRange Periods with a Custom Gap in Between the Events. (Ex: If Events have gap of 1 Sec | 10 Secs | 1 Hour | 1 Day... etc).
	--Approach #2: This Approach is Not Customisable as Approach #1 and "DoesNot Merge the DateRange Periods If Events have More Than 1 MilliSec Gap as well".
	--Approach #3: This Approach is Similar to Approach #2 But Takes More Time To Get the Same Result Set. (Costly Execution Plan Compared to Approach #2).
	--Conclusion : Approach #1 (or) Approach #2 are best suited for any given DataRanges.
	--				Additionally, Approach #1 Merges DateRanges in the Same Table "with Custom Global Gap Period" and It Can Visualises the Output at Each Phase of Process.
	--**Note     : Add More Events (E3, E4, E5.... so on) in the TestEvents Table (##SampleData) for the Same ID and Check the ResultSet.
	--If The EventsTable DoesNot have "ID" column, Then Mark the Value of ID column to 1 for all the events. (Most StackOverFlow Approaches have this kind of Events without ID).
-- History		:
-- Refer Links	: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2561130/merge-overlapping-date-intervals
================================================================================================================================================================================= */
USE tempdb;
GO
--
--$BeginRegion: ##SampleData Table with Sample Data
IF OBJECT_ID('tempdb..##SampleData', 'U') IS NOT NULL
	DROP TABLE ##SampleData;
CREATE TABLE ##SampleData (ID INT NULL, StartTime DATETIME NULL, EndTime DATETIME NULL);
INSERT INTO ##SampleData(ID, StartTime, EndTime)
VALUES-- ID, Event #1 (E1), Event #2 (E2)
	(1, N'2010-01-01 00:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 00:30:00.000'), (1, N'2010-01-01 00:30:01.000', N'2010-01-01 02:00:00.000'),
	(2, N'2010-01-01 03:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 05:00:00.000'), (2, N'2010-01-01 04:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 06:00:00.000'),
	(3, N'2010-01-01 07:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 09:00:00.000'), (3, N'2010-01-01 08:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 09:00:00.000'),
	(4, N'2010-01-01 10:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 11:00:00.000'), (4, N'2010-01-01 10:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 12:00:00.000'),
	(5, N'2010-01-01 13:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 16:00:00.000'), (5, N'2010-01-01 14:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 15:00:00.000'),
	(6, N'2010-01-01 17:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 18:00:00.000'), (6, N'2010-01-01 19:00:00.000', N'2010-01-01 20:00:00.000');
--
SELECT ID, StartTime, EndTime FROM ##SampleData;
--$EndRegion: ##SampleData Table with Sample Data
--
/* ===== ** Approach #1 ** ================================================================================================================================== */
--$BeginRegion: Approach #1
--
--$BeginRegion: Phase #0 - Raw Data Input:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
----1	E1 = 00:00:00.000 to 00:30:00.000 ; E2 = 00:30:01.000 to 02:00:00.000
----2	E1 = 03:00:00.000 to 05:00:00.000 ; E2 = 04:00:00.000 to 06:00:00.000
----3	E1 = 07:00:00.000 to 09:00:00.000 ; E2 = 08:00:00.000 to 09:00:00.000
----4	E1 = 10:00:00.000 to 11:00:00.000 ; E2 = 10:00:00.000 to 12:00:00.000
----5	E1 = 13:00:00.000 to 16:00:00.000 ; E2 = 14:00:00.000 to 15:00:00.000
----6	E1 = 17:00:00.000 to 18:00:00.000 ; E2 = 19:00:00.000 to 20:00:00.000
--$EndRegion: Phase #0 - Raw Data Input:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
DECLARE @i INT=1, @RowCount INT=0;
WHILE(1=1) --Infinite Loop Untill All the Ranges are Sorted and Merged Accordingly
BEGIN
	SET @RowCount=0;
	--
	--$BeginRegion: Phase #1 - Updating E1's EndTime with VeryNext Event E2's EndTime
	UPDATE T1
	SET T1.EndTime=T2.EndTime
	OUTPUT 'Loop #'+CAST(@i AS VARCHAR(4))+' - Phase #1' AS "Phase", Deleted.ID, Deleted.StartTime, Deleted.EndTime, '|' AS "O", Inserted.ID, Inserted.StartTime, Inserted.EndTime
	FROM ##SampleData AS T1
	INNER JOIN ##SampleData AS T2 ON T2.ID=T1.ID
	WHERE DATEADD(SECOND/*This can be Adjusted like MINUTE, HOUR, DAY..etc as Required*/, 1/*This can be Adjusted like 1, 10, 15..etc as Required*/, T1.EndTime) BETWEEN T2.StartTime AND T2.EndTime;
	--
	SET @RowCount=@RowCount+@@ROWCOUNT;
	--$EndRegion: Phase #1 - Updating E1's EndTime with VeryNext Event E2's EndTime
	--
	--$BeginRegion: Phase #1 ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
	----1	E1 = 00:00:00:000 to 02:00:00:000 ; E2 = 00:30:01:000 to 02:00:00:000
	----2	E1 = 03:00:00:000 to 06:00:00:000 ; E2 = 04:00:00:000 to 06:00:00:000
	----3	E1 = 07:00:00:000 to 09:00:00:000 ; E2 = 08:00:00:000 to 09:00:00:000
	----4	E1 = 10:00:00:000 to 12:00:00:000 ; E2 = 10:00:00:000 to 12:00:00:000
	----5	E1 = 13:00:00:000 to 16:00:00:000 ; E2 = 14:00:00:000 to 16:00:00:000
	----6	E1 = 17:00:00:000 to 18:00:00:000 ; E2 = 19:00:00:000 to 20:00:00:000
	--$EndRegion: Phase #1 ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
	--
	--$BeginRegion: Phase #2 - Deleting Overlapped Events If E1's EndTime = E2's EndTime and E2's StartTime > E1's StartTime
	DELETE T1
	OUTPUT 'Loop #'+CAST(@i AS VARCHAR(4))+' - Phase #2' AS "Phase", Deleted.ID, Deleted.StartTime, Deleted.EndTime
	FROM ##SampleData AS T1
	INNER JOIN ##SampleData AS T2 ON T2.ID=T1.ID
	WHERE T1.EndTime=T2.EndTime AND T1.StartTime>T2.StartTime;
	--
	SET @RowCount=@RowCount+@@ROWCOUNT;
	--$EndRegion: Phase #2 - Deleting Overlapped Events If E1's EndTime = E2's EndTime and E2's StartTime > E1's StartTime
	--
	--$BeginRegion: Phase #2 ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
	----1	E1 = 00:00:00:000 to 02:00:00:000 ;
	----2	E1 = 03:00:00:000 to 06:00:00:000 ;
	----3	E1 = 07:00:00:000 to 09:00:00:000 ;
	----4	E1 = 10:00:00:000 to 12:00:00:000 ; E2 = 10:00:00:000 to 12:00:00:000
	----5	E1 = 13:00:00:000 to 16:00:00:000 ;
	----6	E1 = 17:00:00:000 to 18:00:00:000 ; E2 = 19:00:00:000 to 20:00:00:000
	--$EndRegion: Phase #2 ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
	--
	--$BeginRegion: Phase #3 - Deleting Full Duplicate Records w.r.to ID, StartTime, EndTime
	;WITH _GetDups AS --
		(SELECT ID, StartTime, EndTime, DupRN=ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY ID, StartTime, EndTime ORDER BY ID) FROM ##SampleData)
	DELETE _GetDups
	OUTPUT 'Loop #'+CAST(@i AS VARCHAR(4))+' - Phase #3' AS "Phase", Deleted.ID, Deleted.StartTime, Deleted.EndTime, Deleted.DupRN
	FROM _GetDups
	WHERE _GetDups.DupRN>1;
	--
	SET @RowCount=@RowCount+@@ROWCOUNT;
	--$EndRegion: Phase #3 - Deleting Full Duplicate Records w.r.to ID, StartTime, EndTime
	--
	--$BeginRegion: Phase #3 ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
	----1	E1 = 00:00:00:000 to 02:00:00:000 ;
	----2	E1 = 03:00:00:000 to 06:00:00:000 ;
	----3	E1 = 07:00:00:000 to 09:00:00:000 ;
	----4	E1 = 10:00:00:000 to 12:00:00:000 ;
	----5	E1 = 13:00:00:000 to 16:00:00:000 ;
	----6	E1 = 17:00:00:000 to 18:00:00:000 ; E2 = 19:00:00:000 to 20:00:00:000
	--$EndRegion: Phase #3 ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
	--
	SET @i=@i+1;
	IF @RowCount=0 --
		BREAK;
END;
--
SELECT ID, StartTime, EndTime FROM ##SampleData;
--
--$BeginRegion: ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
----1	E1 = 00:00:00.000 to 02:00:00.000 ;
----2	E1 = 03:00:00:000 to 06:00:00:000 ;
----3	E1 = 07:00:00:000 to 09:00:00:000 ;
----4	E1 = 10:00:00:000 to 12:00:00:000 ;
----5	E1 = 13:00:00:000 to 16:00:00:000 ;
----6	E1 = 17:00:00:000 to 18:00:00:000 ; E2 = 19:00:00:000 to 20:00:00:000
--$EndRegion: ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
--
--$EndRegion: Approach #1
--
/* ===== ** Approach #2 ** ================================================================================================================================== */
--$BeginRegion: Approach #2
--
--$BeginRegion: Raw Data Input:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
----1	E1 = 00:00:00.000 to 00:30:00.000 ; E2 = 00:30:01.000 to 02:00:00.000
----2	E1 = 03:00:00.000 to 05:00:00.000 ; E2 = 04:00:00.000 to 06:00:00.000
----3	E1 = 07:00:00.000 to 09:00:00.000 ; E2 = 08:00:00.000 to 09:00:00.000
----4	E1 = 10:00:00.000 to 11:00:00.000 ; E2 = 10:00:00.000 to 12:00:00.000
----5	E1 = 13:00:00.000 to 16:00:00.000 ; E2 = 14:00:00.000 to 15:00:00.000
----6	E1 = 17:00:00.000 to 18:00:00.000 ; E2 = 19:00:00.000 to 20:00:00.000
--$EndRegion: Raw Data Input:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
--
SELECT T1.ID,
	   StartTime = T1.StartTime,
	   EndTime = MIN(T2.EndTime)
FROM ##SampleData AS T1
INNER JOIN ##SampleData AS T2
	ON T1.ID = T2.ID
	   AND T1.StartTime <= T2.EndTime
	   AND NOT EXISTS (
						  SELECT *
						  FROM ##SampleData AS T3
						  WHERE T2.ID = T3.ID
								AND T2.EndTime >= T3.StartTime
								AND T2.EndTime < T3.EndTime
					  )
WHERE NOT EXISTS (
					 SELECT *
					 FROM ##SampleData AS T4
					 WHERE T1.ID = T4.ID
						   AND T1.StartTime > T4.StartTime
						   AND T1.StartTime <= T4.EndTime
				 )
GROUP BY T1.ID,
		 T1.StartTime
ORDER BY T1.StartTime;
--
--$BeginRegion: ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
----1	E1 = 00:00:00.000 to 00:30:00.000 ; E2 = 00:30:01.000 to 02:00:00.000
----2	E1 = 03:00:00:000 to 06:00:00:000 ;
----3	E1 = 07:00:00:000 to 09:00:00:000 ;
----4	E1 = 10:00:00:000 to 12:00:00:000 ;
----5	E1 = 13:00:00:000 to 16:00:00:000 ;
----6	E1 = 17:00:00:000 to 18:00:00:000 ; E2 = 19:00:00:000 to 20:00:00:000
--$EndRegion: ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
--
--$EndRegion: Approach #2
--
/* ===== ** Approach #3 ** ================================================================================================================================== */
--$BeginRegion: Approach #3
--
--$BeginRegion: Raw Data Input:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
----1	E1 = 00:00:00.000 to 00:30:00.000 ; E2 = 00:30:01.000 to 02:00:00.000
----2	E1 = 03:00:00.000 to 05:00:00.000 ; E2 = 04:00:00.000 to 06:00:00.000
----3	E1 = 07:00:00.000 to 09:00:00.000 ; E2 = 08:00:00.000 to 09:00:00.000
----4	E1 = 10:00:00.000 to 11:00:00.000 ; E2 = 10:00:00.000 to 12:00:00.000
----5	E1 = 13:00:00.000 to 16:00:00.000 ; E2 = 14:00:00.000 to 15:00:00.000
----6	E1 = 17:00:00.000 to 18:00:00.000 ; E2 = 19:00:00.000 to 20:00:00.000
--$EndRegion: Raw Data Input:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
--
SELECT DISTINCT ST.ID,
				ST.StartTime,
				ET.EndTime
FROM (
		 SELECT T1.ID, T1.StartTime
		 FROM ##SampleData AS T1
		 LEFT OUTER JOIN ##SampleData AS T2
			 ON T2.ID = T1.ID AND T2.StartTime < T1.StartTime AND T2.EndTime >= T1.StartTime
		 WHERE T2.StartTime IS NULL
	 ) AS ST
INNER JOIN (
			   SELECT T3.ID, T3.EndTime
			   FROM ##SampleData AS T3
			   LEFT OUTER JOIN ##SampleData AS T4
				   ON T4.ID = T3.ID AND T4.EndTime > T3.EndTime AND T4.StartTime <= T3.EndTime
			   WHERE T4.StartTime IS NULL
		   ) AS ET
	ON ET.ID = ST.ID AND ET.EndTime > ST.StartTime
LEFT OUTER JOIN (
					SELECT T5.ID, T5.EndTime
					FROM ##SampleData AS T5
					LEFT OUTER JOIN ##SampleData AS T6
						ON T6.ID = T5.ID AND T6.EndTime > T5.EndTime AND T6.StartTime <= T5.EndTime
					WHERE T6.StartTime IS NULL
				) AS ET2
	ON ET2.ID = ET.ID AND ET2.EndTime > ST.StartTime AND ET2.EndTime < ET.EndTime
WHERE ET2.EndTime IS NULL;
--
--$BeginRegion: ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
----1	E1 = 00:00:00.000 to 00:30:00.000 ; E2 = 00:30:01.000 to 02:00:00.000
----2	E1 = 03:00:00:000 to 06:00:00:000 ;
----3	E1 = 07:00:00:000 to 09:00:00:000 ;
----4	E1 = 10:00:00:000 to 12:00:00:000 ;
----5	E1 = 13:00:00:000 to 16:00:00:000 ;
----6	E1 = 17:00:00:000 to 18:00:00:000 ; E2 = 19:00:00:000 to 20:00:00:000
--$EndRegion: ResultSet:: ID, StartTime, EndTime
--
--$EndRegion: Approach #3
